org.jgapcustomised

Class Species

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgapcustomised.Species

  • public class Species
extends java.lang.Object
    Species are reproductively isolated segments of a population. They are used to ensure diversity in the population. This can protect innovation, and also serve to maintain a broader search space, avoiding being trapped in local optima. Modified by Oliver Coleman 2010-09-11 to use fittest chromosome as representative
    Author:
    Philip Tucker

    • Constructor Detail

      • Species

        public Species(SpeciationParms aSpeciationParms,
       Chromosome aRepresentative)
        Create new specie from representative. Representative is first member of specie, and all other members of specie are determined by compatibility with representative. Even if representative dies from population, a reference is kept here to determine specie membership.
        Parameters:
        aSpeciationParms -
        aRepresentative -

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all chromosomes from this species. NOTE: this method does not update the species field in the removed Chromosomes.

      • cull

        public void cull(java.util.Collection<Chromosome> keepers)
        Remove all chromosomes from this specie except keepers NOTE: this method does not update the species field in the removed Chromosomes.
        Parameters:

      • getChromosomeFitnessValue

        public double getChromosomeFitnessValue(Chromosome aChromosome)
        Parameters:
        aChromosome -
        Returns:
        double adjusted fitness for aChromosome relative to this specie
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if chromosome is not a member if this specie

      • getFitnessValue

        public double getFitnessValue()
        Returns:
        average raw fitness (i.e., not adjusted for specie size) of all chromosomes in specie

      • getElite

        public java.util.List<Chromosome> getElite(double proportion,
                                  int minToSelect)
        Parameters:
        proportion - The proportion of Chromosomes to select, range (0, 1).
        minToSelect - The minimum number of Chromosomes to select. Use 0 for no minimum.
        Returns:
        top proportion (or minToSelect, which ever is greater) of fittest Chromosomes in this species.
